title: Show basic information about workspace
description:
When showing a workspace, instead of the blank page with `Selected workspace !` written in it, we should have:
 - `Welcome to WORKSPACENAME`
 - a list of the users of the workspace
 - the deletion button (in red with a confirmation popup), see #241

title: Notification return undefined: undefined when we try to import a bus
description: ![image](/uploads/5e3beac092b9cf52f27b1ede9d385ad5/image.png)

title: BugFix : Border Image Icon + padding md-dialog
description: ![Sélection_047](/uploads/91384b8be5a724caacdbe4004a9a9931/Sélection_047.png)

title: Redirect to login should send back to originally requested page
Images are not visible anymore when the base href is not /
description:
If you go to http://linagora.gitlab.io/petals-cockpit/, you can see images are missing.

This is most certainly related to ee186ed where `/` were added in front of the asset URLs

title: Add bus/container/component/SU content e2e tests
description: See: https://gitlab.com/linagora/petals-cockpit/blob/c89b653dd525aa5c6abebbd2ae02656ad3df1906/frontend/e2e/workspace-needspetals.e2e-spec.ts

title: Workspaces list should be closeable
description:
Even though a user can close the workspaces list by clicking on the current workspace, it still would make sense that it is closeable in the regular way (by clicking outside of the dialog).

Related : https://github.com/angular/material2/issues/3392
Fix in : https://github.com/angular/material2/pull/3460

title: Add autofocus on the login page
description: The login field should be autofocused.

title: Disable autofocus in mobile mode
description: This is bothering because the keyboard will popup and take all the screen.

title: In mobile, just added new workspace should not have an icon
description: In mobile, the workspaces in the workspaces list have no icon, but if you add one, it will have an icon.

title: Import error on mobile goes out of the screen
Receiving a delete event via SSE should nicely handle the situation if on the deleted element page
description:
As a user, if I'm on an element or subelement that is deleted (su,sa,comp,sl undeploy, bus deletion, bus in progress deletion), I should be notified in a nice way so that I am not surprised and can optionally continue what I was doing if possible.

To be discussed what to do in that case:
 - simply go back to workspace main page
 - lock everything on the page and show a message saying it was deleted?

title: New bus in progress are not broadcasted via SSE
description: If two browsers are open on the same workspace, if one add a new bus in progress, it should appear in the other one (as with a bus import ok).

title: On mobile, clicking on the (+) to import a bus should close the sidebar
During search in tree, elements hidden by fold should be made visible via unfold of their parent
description:
From:
![image](/uploads/3b04876e4cb33ece31efae3e536723ab/image.png)

This is what happens:
![image](/uploads/f22d7ebf6487af41ae7f9574faa83d1a/image.png)

Instead of:
![image](/uploads/1074606c95ee9fef99cca1c1bc5e2d2e/image.png)

title: Show the green led only on the current workspace
description: Feature of the year ! :fireworks:

title: Containers' names in reachabilities are incorrect when using real petals
description:
When importing the bus on petals1, the names of the containers in the reachabilities are incorrect.

It is Container 5 and 6, instead of petals-cockpit1 and 2.

title: Reload on a bus/container/component/su does not work
description:
Workspace is probably not loaded yet.
No error but infinitely loading.

Maybe take this opportunity to use resolve for loading workspace data!

title: Move logout, avatar and name to the top bar
description:
In order to solve #233.

But keep name/avatar on the left when on mobile.

title: Worskpace list should not gray the top bar
description:
In order to solve #233 

Most certainly, the dialog should be moved to the workspaces component and have it constrained to it in term of graying.

title: Workspace deletion UI
description:
Related to #133

The deletion button should be in the workspace configuration pane (see #267), it should be red and a popup should confirm the action with a description of what will happen: everything in the workspace will be deleted.

title: Workspace deletion API
description:
take care of stopping current import and stuffs like that...

Related to #133

title: Component deployment UI
description: Using #235

title: SU deployment UI
description: Using #236

title: Spinner on workspaces list
description: Use the store to display previous data while fetching updated ones

title: SU deployment API
description:
The backend should allow the frontend to trigger SU deployment via zip upload.

Related to #170.

title: Component deployment API
description:
The backend should allow the frontend to trigger component deployment via zip upload.

Related to #182.

title: Serve files toward petals for deployment
description: Related to #182 and #170

title: Add a warning icon next to failed bus in progress in the side bar
Investigate batchActions w.r.t. Effects
description:
Basically, it seems that actions in batchActions are not taken into account by effects…

Either we need to extract the actions that should trigger effects, or this should be fixed upstream.
Second is better of course!

title: Use navigate instead of dispatch when selecting a workspace
description: In the workspace dialog, prefer to use navigate and relies on its implementation to fetch the workspace.

title: Show a message when the search bar doesn't yield any result
description:
So that the user is not confused if she types something in the search bar without paying attention.

Do not forget the following e2e test:
```
    // check there's a warning saying no buses available
    expect(element(by.css(`md-sidenav .info.no-bus`)).getText())
      .toEqual(`The workspace "Workspace 0" doesn't match any bus, container, component or SU with a name containing "Some random search".`);
```

title: Incoherent state of bus import view just after import is clicked
description:
When importing a bus (with the mocks, the second time for example, when we will receive an error from the SSE), the following things happen:
 - we click on import
 - import become grayed
 - import become clickable again <- this moment happens because the store is updated before we are redirected to the newly created bus in progress
 - the url change and the view is reloaded has it is expected

The 3rd point shouldn't happen

I think it is also related to #220…

title: Rework the SSE on the frontend side
description:
Two problems:
 - we need to be 100% sure that all events that arrive on the SSE since the moment we opened it are processed (currently it is not the case in some extreme cases)
 - we need to be sure the subscription done for each of the events are properly closed when changing workspaces (currently it is not the case at all)

title: Improve mocks for failing bus import
description:
Currently, the mocks fail with an HTTP error on the first import, fail with an SSE error on the second import, and works for the rest.

We should introduce special ips where it fails, to let people play with it as they want as well as exploit it for the tests!

title: Uniformise identifier for users with the rest in the backend
description:
Users are identified via the `username` field, while all the other datatypes are using the `id` field.

It would be better to use `id` everywhere, and then simplify the code in the frontend thanks to that.
Do not forget to update the mocks too.

title: Add a clear button to the import bus form
Show workspaces users in workspaces list
description:
In the workspace list, even if a workspace has multiple users, it is always written: `You're the only one to use this workspace`

This #237 .

This is too much, we should not see this kind of things

title: Ensure frontend works with backend!
description:
In particular w.r.t. #180, #188, #187, #186!

Todo:
* [x]  bus import (#191 !201)
* [x]  bus discard (#222 !205)
* [x]  add workspace (#221 !209)
* [x]  verify that the connected user is shown (#218 !202)
* [x]  ensure e2e tests pass

title: Show and modify component configuration parameters
description:
As a user, when clicking on a component in the workspace tree, I should be able to see the values of its configuration parameters.

It should show me which one are modifiable at runtime, and allow me to modify them.

It should also show me those that are not modifiable (because they are only configurable, see #183 or not modifiable).

title: Preload main application js chunk while user is logging in
description: When #178 is fixed, it would be great that while the user is logging in, the rest of the application be loaded so that everything seems smooth.

title: Add copyrights to bundled js produced by angular-cli
description:
Only keep one at the head of each file!

See http://webpack.github.io/docs/list-of-plugins.html#bannerplugin

title: Allow to redo a previously failed bus import
description: As a user, after I do an import and it fails, I should be able to change the settings and click on a Redo button.

title: Add admin user by default
description: As a user, when I start cockpit for the first time, when opening the website, I want to be prompted for creating a first admin user.

title: Add License information to deliverable
description:
The deliverable should contain LICENSE and COPYRIGHT files.

Related to #177.

title: Laxer validation on backend output
description:
Currently, the backend validates what is sent back to the frontend quite strictly (e.g., empty name for workspace will issue an error 500).

It would make sense to enable this only at dev time and prefer to have this insured by being strict on input coming from frontend.

title: test to import a bus
description:
- first import should fail, verify that the error is displayed
- second import should work, verify that it's in the sidenav

See also #225

title: Allow to cancel a bus import
description:
During a bus import, if it gets stuck, then the user could want to cancel it.

It should abort everything server-side too (killing actors, removing from db, etc)

title: change server default port
description:
Currently, the default port is 8080.

As we discussed during our sprint review (end sprint 2, begin sprint 3), many apps uses that port.
It'd be convenient to change it.

title: Improve error message on import bus failure
description:
Currently, we see things like that:
`"org.ow2.petals.jmx.api.api.exception.ConnectionErrorException: Can not connect using URI : service:jmx:rmi:///jndi/rmi://localhost:7701/PetalsJMX with lol/lol"`

There is extra Exceptions as well as the password visible... !

title: remember last workspace of user
description: As a user, when I open Petals Cockpit, I want to be directly on my last used workspace.

title: Make the executable product runnable without any configuration by default

Put logs in file.

title: Workspace collaboration
description: As a workspace user, I can add and remove users from the the workspaces I have access to, because I want to collaborate with them on the same data.

description: Backend should check if a workspace name already exists before creating a new one.

title: [UI] Prevent workspaces duplicates

As for now, loaded SL version are not visible (except sometimes when uploading a component).  
It should be visible in an informational card, like this one:

ABOUT {SL name}
version {SL version}

title: Do the release

description:
Currently, when the user tries to access to an URL that does not exists, the application simply fails and must be reloaded.

We should at least redirect the user to the workspace instead (and later handle this via #164)

title: Rework the workspace page
Make the backend relying as much as possible on the containers instead of db
description:
Related to #168.

Rewrite all the mutations/commands in the backend so that they act by working directly with the container instead of the db.
The db would only be there to store some view of the current state of the system, but not as input for mutations.

Note: this an event sourcing way of architecturing things, ultimately we would want to remove any db related code from the workspace actor and populate the db on the side based on the events happening.

The SA operations tab should show:

The SU operations tab should show:

The `SA_CHANGE_STATE` SSE event should also be taken into account (and maybe the `SU_CHANGE_STATE` removed).

The SU overview should show (when clicking from its tree node under a component or an SA):

description:

This maybe means that `SU_DEPLOYED` event will be removed...

title: [API] SA lifecycle management
description:
After #319 is done, we can introduce:
 - `PUT` on `/workspaces/ID/serviceassemblies/ID` for changing state

We should also remove:
 - `PUT` on `/workspaces/ID/serviceunits/ID` for changing state
 

This maybe means that the `SU_STATE_CHANGE` event will be removed but maybe not...

title: [API] introduce Service Assemblies in backend
description:
Introduce:
 - `GET` on `/serviceassemblies/ID` for read operations
 - `serviceassemblies` field in `/workspaces/ID` response
 - `serviceassemblies` field in the `WORKSPACE_CONTENT` SSE event
 - `serviceassembly` field in the SU responses

For this we may need to:
 - add some migration db step to create the existing SUs corresponding SAs and move their state to it
 - change some URLs and datatypes on the frontend for it to continue to work as before (e.g., changing the state of an SU by changing the state of its SA).

title: SA multi SU
description:
As a user, I want to: 
- Deploy SAs on containers
- See them in the tree under the container
- Manage their lifecycle
- See their SUs from their overview
- Go to the SA from the SU

I still want to be able to deploy an SU from a component, and its SA (mono SU) should be visible with the others.

title: Show error in case of deploy and lifecycle problem for SUs and Components

This error should be shown on the page.

title: Container overview with nice schemas
description:
As a user, when I click on a container, I would like to see some kind of schema that summarise the state of the container.

~~A first idea is to have an heatmap where the elements are the components, the size the number of service deployed and the colour a shade from red to green based on the % of started SU.~~ moved to #338

title: Bus overview with nice schema
description:
As a user, when I click on a bus, I want to see in its overview the following elements:
 - ~~configured registries~~ (later: #150)
 - containers

And I want to see it in a nice schema where you can click on the containers for example.

title: Event from the SSE shouldn't redirect people that didn't initiate the action!
description:
Currently, when we receive an event from the SSE about a new deployed component, SU, unloaded artefact, deleted bus, etc, everybody gets redirected to the newly deployed component or su.
But if I am not the initiator of the action, I don't want that!

The solution should be done by differentiating the direct result of the action (the success of the http call) from the indirect result of the action (the receival of the event from the SSE).

title: Add Components, SLs and SUs by using an URL
description: As a user, I want to be able to add/deploy a component, a SL or a SU by giving an URL to the artefact.

title: When clearing the form import bus, also clean errors (if any)

I made an import, it failed.

So far, so good, the error is displayed.

Then I cleaned it but the error's still here :

title: Opened container content page interferes with workspace change
description:
If one clicks on a container of a bus (e.g., http://linagora.gitlab.io/petals-cockpit/#/workspaces/idWks0/petals/containers/idCont0) and tries to change workspace, the following error happens:
```
ERROR Error: Uncaught (in promise): TypeError: Cannot read property 'containers' of undefined
TypeError: Cannot read property 'containers' of undefined
```

Most certainly because closing the workspace remove whatever is needed by the container content page.

Best would be to completely avoid that situation by not closing the workspace until the url changed.

title: Transaction and error status do not work well together
description: In the backend, in WorkspaceActor, we should prefer throwing exception instead of returning status to be sure things are rolled back in case it is needed!

title: Unreachable containers should be shown too in the container overview
description: Currently only reachable containers are listed, but the unreachable ones are the important ones from an administration point of view.

title: Component lifecycle management API
description:
See #11.

We should handle well the case where there is deployed SUs on a component and it thus can't be unloaded!

title: Components lifecycle management UI
description:
See #11 

It should be using a PUT on /workspaces/WID/components/COMPID with a body:
```
{
    "state": "Started"
}
```

Note that the possible transitions are:
- shutdown->Started
- shutdown->Unloaded
- stopped->Started
- stopped->Unloaded
- started->Stopped
- loaded->Unloaded
- loaded->Started

And also it can't be unloaded if there is SUs deployed on it.

Note also that the CONFLICT status code will be returned if the transition is not valid.
So there is no way to go directly to the shutdown and loaded states, but they are states where a component can be!

You will also get an event on the SSE of type `COMPONENT_STATE_CHANGE` containing something like:
```
{
    "id": 24,
    "state": "Started"
}
```

title: SU lifecycle management UI
description:
See #12.

It should be using a PUT on /workspaces/WID/serviceunits/SUID with a body:
```
{
    "state": "Started"
}
```

Note that the possible transitions are:
- shutdown->Started
- shutdown->Unloaded
- stopped->Started
- stopped->Unloaded
- started->Stopped

Note also that the CONFLICT status code will be returned if the transition is not valid.

So there is no way to go directly to the shutdown state, but it is a state where an SU can be!

You will also get an event on the SSE of type `SU_STATE_CHANGE` containing something like:
```
{
    "id": 24,
    "state": "Started"
}
```
